AITA for getting a gift in the mail? I got a gift in the mail today. Addressed to me with my address and my full name (people usually call me by my nickname). There were two necklaces, a ring, a guitar tuner with batteries, guitar strings and a tactical weapon to use in your fist if you want to punch someone.

My fiance is accusing me of cheating on him because the handwriting on the box looks like a man may have wrote it.

I'm definitely not cheating on him. Someone knows my full name and obviously knows I'm learning guitar. I'm seriously freaked out and worried about it because of the tactical tool in the box, too.

My plan of action is calling the USPS tomorrow and see if there is any info on the tracking number. After that, I'm calling the police to make a report to have on record.

My fiance is telling me that he thinks I'm cheating on him because of all this stuff. My fiance is out of his ever-loving mind if he thinks I'd do that. I'll be 49 soon and I'm wayyyyy too old for that shit. I'm a good, honest woman. If I had something to hide, why would I show him? Makes no sense. I've offered to show him my internet history but he refuses to look at it.

I'm taking precautionary measures tomorrow in case I have a stalker somehow. Does that make me an asshole for getting a package of stuff I didn't want?

WIBTA if I didn’t give my staff free shirts because there’s not a size for everyone? So for starters, I run a bar and a few weeks back I announced we’d be running a promo (this Friday) on a specific drink and that there’d be swag to give out and so on. As part of the promo I was told I would be able to get free shirts for the staff so I collected everyone’s sizes. Most of them wanted smalls and mediums but there was one request for a large and one request for a 2XL. I relayed all of our shirt sizes to the beverage rep and she told me she’d see what she could do.

Fast forward to yesterday and the beverage rep delivered the shirts, yay! Except they are all smalls and mediums with one large. So now I am left with one person without a shirt and that person is one who stays until close while most of the others are cut out early. She also has privately discussed with me that weight is a very sensitive topic for her, so I do not wish to upset her at all. Since I do not have a shirt for her I plan on telling my staff there was a change of plans and that the shirts will be given out to customers. I ran this by one of my senior staff and she threw a fit and said that life isn’t fair so I shouldn’t take away the free shirt from everyone else just because there isn’t one for one of them. 

So, WIBTA if I took away a gift from everyone just because one person wouldn’t be able to enjoy it?

AITA for cutting off my mom? So there’s A LOT of context behind this. About two years ago I came out to her as transgender (mtf) and for a while she was super supportive.  When I started HRT she instantly changed and became aggressive against the idea.  She would threaten me with disowning, cutting me off financially, and used college as a bargaining chip against me.  This became extremely emotionally draining, as all of our discussions degraded into us fighting.  She would give the usual “you’re too young” and “i know you better and all your friends are brainwashed”.  It has degraded to the point where she believes in a medical conspiracy that is pushing me to be trans. I intentionally tried to avoid her and refused to come home to visit during holidays.  

The final straw came when I was in the hospital after a mental health episode and she has been shaming me for getting mental help.  She stated that I only when to the psych ward because “I wanted to get out of an exam”. I essentially told her that if she “Can’t swallow her pride long enough to admit she’s wrong then she has no reason to call this number”.  This, along with her threats of using this event as legal grounds to declare me incompetent has led to this decision.

There are other things as well, including her berating me for having mental health issues (since middle school) despite the fact they run particularly strong on my dad’s side.  Along with that, my father passed away 4 years ago and she began speaking worse and worse about him to the point she tried to convince me that I was abused.  She often uses this as justification for her actions despite the fact my dad knew I was queer since childhood and never once acted in malice against it.

I am concerned because she still tries to maintain that she treats me this way out of love but my mental health always improves dramatically when I’m away from her. She’s threatened that my family will “come after me” if I ever cut ties with her and I am partly concerned for my safety.  I have enough money and a deal made with the university so I can finish college without debt but I still fear what my mother might try to do to me legally since I had a severe breakdown earlier in the year.  I know she does this in some misguided intent of caring for me but I cannot mentally take it anymore as it has proven to be extremely detrimental to my health and safety. AITA for cutting ties with her?

AITA for having my own WiFi and changing the password? I’ve been living with P & Q for almost a year now. P is a person I knew from high school. Q is somebody I met briefly at a bar a year or two ago. It just so happened that the two of them live together and P asked me if I wanted to move in to a bedroom that was recently vacated. When I first moved in a year ago, I noticed that the house had a router, but I assumed that it belonged to P or Q. I had brought along a lot of devices for my room to connect to the Internet and I didn’t want to slow down their Internet. So, I decided to get my own router. I had mentioned it to P beforehand and he didn’t ask any questions about it. While I was setting it up, P was gone to see his family for the weekend and Q was in and out of the house, but he didn’t ask any questions about it. After some time, I noticed a couple things. First, the router in the house belonged to the landlord. Second, I found that my router’s signal was slightly stronger than the other router. I assumed it was due to the fact that the other router already had a bunch of devices connected to it and so I didn’t think much of it. 

A month ago, I noticed that my WiFi was acting a lot slower than usual. I decided to check the device list for the WiFi and noticed a few devices listed online that I didn’t recognize. So, I reset my router and change the password. I didn’t think much of this either until a day later when Q mentioned that he got booted off the WiFi (he referred to it by the name of the router manufacturer) and had to go back to the old WiFi at the house. That’s when I remembered that I had signed his laptop onto the WiFi a couple months ago since we were trying to watch a livestream of a football game and his WiFi (from the original router) was dropping in and out. While he left to go grab something from his room, I switched his laptop over to my WiFi. We were both pretty drunk at the time. So, neither of us remembered it (until recently for me) and Q never brought it up to me. I realize now that Q’s laptop was one of those devices. 

Now, Q always mentions how he got booted off and is not sure why/what happened. It’s put me in a bit of an awkward spot because I’m not sure if I’m an asshole for withholding my WiFi from my roommates. If I tell them about how I have my own router, I’m afraid that they’ll get mad at me for withholding it from them. While I told P about it long ago and Q saw me set it up, I don’t know if they remember that. 

Part of that fear also stems from a gradual falling out that I’m having with them (Q especially), where Q has explicitly said that he wished I didn’t live at the house and that he would’ve moved out if he had known earlier that I was moving in. So, I don’t foresee the friendship really extending beyond the moment I leave. Right now, I’m planning on just kinda keeping the situation as it is right now and just enduring the awkwardness until the end of our lease in a few weeks. Am I an asshole for doing this?

AITA for not telling my best friends wife he was cheating on her? I've been debating this for weeks and I'm still unsure. 

My best friend, a guy (I'm female) has been having an affair, it's not the first time he has done something like this. The wife knew about one instance and forgave it. He didn't leave because he thought they could fix it and I think she was always scared to leave him. 

 I'm absolutely not defending his behaviour other than to say they were unhappy and its simply taken a long time to leave her because she kept putting that decision on him. They had issues but nothing huge, just small things that pilled up, another reason why it took so long for things to end. 

A few weeks ago we had a talk and he let slip that he's been playing around, I had a suspicion but he refused to tell me due to knowing I'd lose my shit. After he told me, it took another week for him to end his nearly two decade long marriage and I felt relived that it was finally done. 

My issue is, am I an asshole for not going to her with my suspicion that he was cheating? Bare in mind I've know her as long as I've known him but he is my friend, she was simply a friend through being his wife. Some part of me feels like it would have ended sooner if I'd told her, maybe saving her time she could have spent recovering but probably destroying my friendship with my bf in the process. Some part of me has that need for female solidarity and feels like I betrayed the sisterhood. One reason I didn't tell her was because he said he was ending it eventually, even when I had my suspicion months ago, he was adamant he was ending his marriage it was just about when. So I figured it would be better if she didn't know. That last part is void because she now knows and she's furious (rightly so). 

It's just an awkward situation and I'm not sure if I should have done things differently? AITA here?

WIBTA for cutting my family out of my life when I turn 17 I'm gonna try to keep it simple. Things for me at home aren't exactly all that nice. My parents are constantly fighting and want a divorce. my mother's basically never present at this point and literally ONLY comes home for food or a place to sleep for the night (She spends the rest of the time with her boyfriend, whom I'm not too fond of due to his background and past acts, and the fact that he has been arrested multiple times. But my mom believes everyone deserves a second chance.) This always has my dad being agitated or things like that, and he often vents it by yelling at us or ranting for a while. and my mother always says that "she loves us" yet she basically acts like we don't exist anymore. not to mention they want me to choose who to go live with. which I don't want to hurt either party. So I've been refusing to choose one. But I'm sick of this lifestyle, I'm leaving as soon as I turn 17 (About 7 months from now.) and I haven't told either of them my plans yet because I know they'll do everything in their power to stop me. But I'm not happy with the way I'm living right now. my current plan is that the day I turn 17, I'm gonna leave town and state with a couple thousand dollars that I'm earning from a job I work at. I may or may not tell the day before. but all I know is that I WILL be doing that.. But when I do that, I want to just start a new life, that means dropping connections with my current family that's basically falling apart day by day, which already forces me in an unhappy situation that I want out of. 

WIBTA for leaving for leaving even against their will and just trying to force myself out of the situation?

TL;DR I'm leaving town and state when I turn 17, whether or not my parents will be against doesn't change what I will do. but that also means I'll be dropping my connections to them a lot and will be almost independent of them, requiring little, if anything at all from them. WIBTA?

Edit: the Legal age of being allowed to leave the household is 17 in my state, I've done a little research, not to mention my sister did the same thing when she turned 17 as well and the fighting started. Also, Where I'll be moving to, the people I'll stay with won't face any legal trouble, I've done my research a bit.

AITA for choosing not to do anything about an annoying classmate being called names? Throwaway account because my friends follow my regular one and I’d rather they not see this. 

So I’m a junior in high school and like all juniors in high school, most of us look down on the freshmen. But I really try not to. I’ve gotten to know some really sweet freshies on the swim team, and the ones who go to Gender-Sexuality Alliance too. Obviously I understand the resent, as I was pretty chaotic as a freshman myself. But overall, I try to see past that. 

However, there’s this one kid in my band class. We’ll call him Neil. He plays oboe and does so pretty well, but he is probably the most annoying freshman I know of. And this ain’t a thing of most people love him but I don’t vibe with him. No. This kid is very much disliked by our entire band class because of his snarky, pretentious attitude. 

To give you some examples, one time my band director was correcting the double reeds on something, and out of nowhere Neil suddenly says, “My mom’s a doctor!” People laughed, not with him but at him. I, who sit right near to him, shot a look at my stand partner, and we both silently said to each other, “This is happening.”

He also one time called a lot of my upperclassmen friends bitches for no apparent reason. He’s been in high school for no more than a month. 

Then at our first football game of the marching season, we were told to wear black and red, our school colors, since we didn’t have our uniforms ready yet. And everyone shows up accordingly, all except for Neil, who comes with a bright blue sweater and gray shorts. When he was asked why, he went, “I mean I own black and red clothes but I didn’t feel like changing.” Not an excuse, if you ask me. 

So you’ve got the gist of things, now we get on to the important bit. So Neil’s an Indian-American, and he’s also very short and speaks with a high-pitched voice. His face also happens to be quite punchable. Not that anyone has punched his face, but who knows. 

So because of that, the band kids (mostly sophomores who tend to be nastiest to the freshies) started calling him Baljeet, after the character from Phineas and Ferb. I’m hearing it everywhere now, and everywhere Neil goes people start going “Eyyyy Baljeet!” He’s told them to stop, but no one has. 

I hate bullying. I’ve been there, done that. It’s an awful experience and I don’t want people to go through it. But now I don’t know what to do. I feel like if Neil had a better attitude about band, and was nicer to people than he’s been, people would take to him better. But you can’t ever justify being deliberately mean to someone. And he’s told them to stop, and so far I haven’t done anything. I’m a bystander. 

He’s not the only freshie with attitude problems, so I’m thinking of gathering all of the freshies in band and just giving them a gentle wake up call about their attitude. Who knows if it’ll work. 

So for the time being, AITA for not doing anything about an annoying kid getting called names?

AITA Trying to order takeout I won't name the restaurant. Every Tuesday is pasta night. I think it's $5 off for any pasta.

It's large portions so it's enough for 2 meals. The plan was order some pasta and take it to work for 2nd shift. Perfect for 2 nights of dinner.

So I place my order to go. I was told the special only applies to eat-in, not take out. I don't understand this but say fine. So I take a seat at a table. They bring my food. I take a bite, tell them I'm full and want the rest in a doggy bag to go.

Why did I have to waste everyone's time to get my food? Take up table space, dirty some dishes etc. Either way the server got his 20% tip. I couldn't order a beer because I was on the way to work.

A couple of weeks later I went back. The server recognized me and let me do takeout. No problems. This went on for a couple months. Next time I went in the server told me his boss have him shit for doing it. So I had to to sit down again, order, them ask for a doggy bag. I guess this made his boss happy.

AITA?

Edit: for clarity.
My options are to eat in and pay $20 with tip or take out and pay $20 with tip. Since I don't order drinks or dessert in either scenario the cost is the same both ways.

I will sit in next time and finish half before taking the rest out. Full price or sale I can't eat more than that anyways. The only difference is I'm now taking up space and dirtying dishes.

Thanks for the feedback

AITA for not taking a drifter in my truck? I am a truck driver and literally just try to do my thing and get my cargo's delivered on time. A while back I was driving through a wooded area and a woman ran out in front of my truck. She said 'help me someone is after me'. 

I told her to hop in (the doors were locked) and when she moved out of the way of the truck, I drove off leaving her behind. I know you might think this is cruel but this is a typical scam I have long know of whereby truck drivers are waylaid by scum (distracted by a woman) and then robbed. 

My duty is first and foremost to my employer and getting the deliveries on time.

AITA for being better safe than sorry?

WIBTA If I go around my teacher and help my class? Okay, so this is pretty simple, and I hope that it doesn't get removed for validation, but I'm actually nervous about the reaction of my teacher and then my parents.

So I'm a sophomore in high school (10th grade, 15m). At my school, the administration requires teachers to have both a Google Classroom page and a Google Calendar, both for keeping track of assignments. My biology teacher has both of these things but skirts around the rules a little bit.

The Google Classroom is basically barren because she doesn't post to it. The only thing on it is a link to her 'website' (section on a laggy school website). The other thing is the Google Calendar page. What bugs me about it is that she just put "See Unit 2 Sheet" on almost every day. The Unit 2 Sheet also has a calendar on it, and it's a paper version that she hands out at the beginning of every month, but if someone doesn't have the paper, there's a good chance that they don't know the homework.

Yesterday some of the kids in the class confronted her on this, and said that it was kind of useless to have a Calendar, which sparked her on a rant about how we were never going to survive in the real world if we expected this kind of treatment, that back in her day people used planners and Google didn't exist. Standard boomer ranting material.

I came up with an idea, which is that since the month is almost over, at the start of November, I would create a calendar and actually write all the stuff in it, and post it to her classroom, basically giving every student what they want.

WIBTA if I do this?

Edit: I'll post an update when November rolls around.

(seriously, this isn't validation posting I'm seriously concerned)

AITA for arguing with a customer about her child running around the library and screaming/laughing loudly? I work at a library, when a woman came in with her daughter. At first, when the two were in the designated children's area, it was fine that the child was having fun and making noise, as it wasn't bothering anyone. However, when she brought her child into the main part of the library where it is generally quieter, the woman continued to play with her child in the same manner, making enough noise to disrupt other customers. 

I thought to myself that she should either quieten down or go back into the children's area where they were free to make noise. But then I got busy doing something else and forgot about it. A couple of minutes later, an elderly man reading a newspaper spoke up to the woman. I had no idea what he said, but he ended up leaving in a mood.

The woman then came up to the counter with her child and told me that the man told her to 'get lost' at the end of their argument. Rather than apologize and end the issue (which I probably should have done), I explained that there is a designated children's area, where there is plenty of space to run around and make noise. Then she said she doesn't understand my viewpoint and that children should be encouraged to come into libraries and restructuring them to one area won't do that. She asked for my name and wanted to make a formal complaint. That's when I apologized as I wasn't going to risk losing my job over something so trivial.

Was I the a-hole for speaking up?

AITA for telling a guy I'd date him before ghosting him? So, last summer, I went to a party with my best friend. One of the boys there hands us two drinks, so we start drinking. Well...

I’m not good at holding my liquor. I don’t know what they gave me, but I don’t even want to talk about the state I was in for the rest of the night. Not my proudest moment. Anyway, I was chatting with some boys I didn’t really know, and one of them stood out to me.

In a normal situation, he may would’ve been my type. He wasn’t handsome, but he was really smart, kinda shy, etc. We start talking. I get the feeling he’s cute, but once again, I’m dead drunk. So at one point, I told my bf et one of her guy friends (we’ll call him C) that I find thi guy (let’s call him T) really cute and that’d I 100% date him.

I guess C told T to try his luck because next thing I knew, T was taking me to an isolated spot.

I don’t even remember the moment he took me out, I was so drunk I had several black outs during the party. Anyway, we start chatting and stuff ; I was showing him pictures of my pets. All of a sudden, he kissed me.

I didn’t react. I laughed awkwardly, and even tho I don’t clearly picture this moment, I recall feelin something wasn't right. Like « oh wait, you’re kissing me in front of a picture of my doggo ? This ain’t cool ». I said nothing and just kept on showing him pics (drunk me ain’t the best decision maker). I just recall he kissed me several times after that, and I still didn’t react. Maybe I should’ve get up and left.

Then I received a call from my father. He was angry af. It was 4am and I had told him I’d be home at 12pm. I was startin to panick — my best friend was too drunk to take me home. T. offered me a ride home. I thought it was nice, and I didn’t really have any other choice. I completely blacked out the rest of the night. I think he kissed me before dropping me off but that’s about it.

That’s the last time I talked to him. Waking up in the morning, thinking about what had happened with T — it felt really wrong. He sent me a text + a pm on fb, but I didn’t answer. I should’ve told him I was not feeling comfortable with pursuing anything with him. But just looking at the notification of his texts made my heart sank.

I thought that was the end of it. But in December my best friend asks C if she can bring me as her +1 at his NYE party. We thought he’d be cool with it since we were on good terms (I hadn’t talk to or seen C since that party). 

To be short, he told her I wouldn't be welcome because of my slutty behavior by leading T on and then crushing his hopes. My bf argued that I was drunk, he was sober and should've known better than to get his hopes up on a drunk girl. But C insisted, tellin her T was a nice guy who didn't deserve that.

So all the boys in my hometown think I’m a massive slut. They come to me to tell me I shouldn’t have been such a bitch. I’m starting to think it really was my fault, that I shouldn’t have drunk that day. So, AITA ?

AITA for telling my sister that she should let me stay a whole week at her apartment? I recently went on vacation to visit some friends and family. My daughter came with me. She's 5 and has a lot of energy but she is sweet and kind. When I told my sister I was coming she said I could stay with them (her, husband and one year old boy). They all sleep together in one room and we spend most of the day out of the apartment. When I am in the apartment, I help my sister with her baby because she gets lonely and overwhelmed. 

So the time came and I told her I was coming for a week. She hesitated and said she didn't want me to stay that long, but two days would be fine. I asked her why and she said she is just too stressed and it's different when it's our parents staying there because they help. Last time I was there, her boy was sick and I took care of him quite a bit and helped clean up. So I got upset when she said that. She said it feels too crowded and I said "Okay, well you lived with my ex and me and our daughter for 9 months and it was crowded but family is family." 

She ended up calling my parents crying hysterically and saying that I was mean to her. She also told them that I only helped like an hour last time I was there, which she later took back and admitted was much more than that. I don't get why she, a 26(f) did that. Of course, since I'm older, I got accused of being a bully. But when I showed my parents the messages, they said they really weren't mean. But my sister insists that it was manipulative (and even said I was like my abusive ex) to say that "family is family". AITA here? Should I apologize for that?

AITA for borrowing my roommate’s car to drive cross-country without telling him exactly where I went? Keeping it short. I live with 3 people, 1 guy 2 girls (I’m a girl too.) The guy and I are good friends and we help each other with small favors from time to time. We’re all in university.

AITA For being angry at my sister for not attending our fathers funeral because of his criminal history. My father died right before new years. He passed away from natural causes while incarcerated and serving a life sentence. His next parole hearing was in less than a year but he suffered from lung cancer (smoker) and he also had a hip injury last october which at 70 can lead to complications.

My father was a provider to a family of three kids, my mother never had to work. He paid for my sisters wedding. He paid for my brothers braces and dental work all out of pocket. At home I would say that he was kind to us 70% of the time.
